newsitem.title: CHINA: U.S. consul-general in China city killed in crash.
newsitem.headline: U.S. consul-general in China city killed in crash.

text.p: The U.S. consul-general in the southern China city of Guangzhou has been killed in a car crash along with two Chinese citizens, a U.S. embassy official said on Tuesday.
Philip Lincoln was killed on Monday in the southern region of Guangxi. Also killed were Huang Honghui, head of the Beihai city foreign affairs department, and their driver.
They were on an official tour when the accident occurred.
Lincoln, a native of Michigan, took up his post in August. He had previously served in Sydney, Seoul and Taipei.
Officials could not immediately give Lincoln's age and hometown.
